title: Error using Google Colab to create training set
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

I am trying to create a training set for DLC in Google Colab using the template provided. I keep getting an error every time I run the code and am unsure how to fix it. Some say that the template uses a depreciated version of DLC and I may need to update it but I have no idea how to do so. Any advice would be appreciated! Thank you all!

`/content/drive/My Drive/Angled_Project-Kevin-2022-06-21/training-datasets/iteration-0/UnaugmentedDataSet_Angled ProjectJun21  already exists!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-15-1ea74fe54287> in <module>()
      2 #Then, run this cell. There are many more functions you can set here, including which network to use.
      3 #check the docstring for full options you can do!
----> 4 deeplabcut.create_training_dataset(path_config_file, net_type='resnet_50', Shuffles=[SHUF], augmenter_type='imgaug')

3 frames
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/deeplabcutcore/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py in create_training_dataset(config, num_shuffles, Shuffles, windows2linux, userfeedback, trainIndexes, testIndexes, net_type, augmenter_type)
    692             # Saving data file (convert to training file for deeper cut (*.mat))
    693             ################################################################################
--> 694             data, MatlabData = format_training_data(Data, trainIndexes, nbodyparts, project_path)
    695             sio.savemat(os.path.join(project_path,datafilename), {'dataset': MatlabData})
    696 

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/deeplabcutcore/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py in format_training_data(df, train_inds, nbodyparts, project_path)
    548         filename = df.index[i]
    549         data['image'] = filename
--> 550         img_shape = _read_image_shape_fast(os.path.join(project_path, filename))
    551         try:
    552             data['size'] = img_shape[2], img_shape[0], img_shape[1]

/usr/lib/python3.7/posixpath.py in join(a, *p)
     92                 path += sep + b
     93     except (TypeError, AttributeError, BytesWarning):
---> 94         genericpath._check_arg_types('join', a, *p)
     95         raise
     96     return path

/usr/lib/python3.7/genericpath.py in _check_arg_types(funcname, *args)
    151         else:
    152             raise TypeError('%s() argument must be str or bytes, not %r' %
--> 153                             (funcname, s.__class__.__name__)) from None
    154     if hasstr and hasbytes:
    155         raise TypeError("Can't mix strings and bytes in path components") from None

TypeError: join() argument must be str or bytes, not 'tuple'`

### Operating System

Google Colab on a Windows 7 Computer

### DeepLabCut version

2+

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

gpu

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

_No response_
